alert.note: Alert for Polk (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 24 at 8:46PM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota... Sand Hill River at Climax affecting Polk County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Dakota...Minnesota... Sheyenne River Diversion at West Fargo affecting Cass County. Maple River near Mapleton (South of I-94) affecting Cass County. Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Walsh, Kittson, Marshall and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at Pembina affecting Kittson and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at Oslo affecting Walsh, Polk, Grand Forks and Marshall Counties. Red River of the North at Halstad affecting Norman and Traill Counties. Red River of the North at East Grand Forks affecting Polk and Grand Forks Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. Red River of the North at Wahpeton affecting Richland and Wilkin Counties. Wild Rice River (MN) at Hendrum affecting Norman County. Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. Wild Rice River (ND) near Abercrombie affecting Richland County. Sheyenne River at Harwood affecting Cass County. .Red River basin river flooding to continue. Additional snow melt and precipitation later this week could affect the northern points along the Red. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River of the North at East Grand Forks. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 41.5 feet, Flood gates on English Coulee are closed, pump station and diversion gates are activated. (Grand Forks) * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Monday the stage was 40.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM CDT Monday was 40.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 41.0 feet Saturday evening. A bump from new snowmelt could occur at any point during this long, flat crest, causing a slight additional rise. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
